column4: I have ubuntu server installed and am trying to figure out how to configure my ethernet device so that when I plug in a cable it will get an ip address via DHCP. Currently, if I boot without a cable plugged in and then plug it in after it is up, it will not grab an IP address.
That will get me an IP address, but I want it to do it automatically.
allow-hotplug ethX    in /etc/network/interfaces
Use "allow-hotplug eth0" instead of "auto eth0"?
not instead, add it
okay, I'll give that a shot.
that doesn't seem to help. I see the "eth0: link up" in my messages file, but I don't see it tried to get an IP address.
did you disable networkmanager?
It's possible, I don't see the process running.
allow-hotplug eth0, auto eth0, iface eth0 inet dhcp             those 3 lines should be in your interfaces
